Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of possible lotus bud in added white outline and added red centre above white band; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of neck, hair spiral and wing with red patch of sphinx to left.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the third stage of the Group of the Simple Figures. The vases in this group were probably all produced by the same hand. The leading vase from this group is the Tarentum chalice (Lemos 1991, no. 938). Flat-headed passant sphinxes with long hair falling in three separate tresses are a recurrent theme.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 131, p. 289, no. 862, pl. 119)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1026) (phase 2)
